00030 /*
00031  * The CRC32 implementation is from RFC 1952, which bears the
00032  * following notice:
00033  *
00034  * Copyright (c) 1996 L. Peter Deutsch
00035  *
00036  * Permission is granted to copy and distribute this document for any
00037  * purpose and without charge, including translations into other
00038  * languages and incorporation into compilations, provided that the
00039  * copyright notice and this notice are preserved, and that any
00040  * substantive changes or deletions from the original are clearly
00041  * marked.
00042  */
00043 
00044 /*
00045  * The purpose of this test is to exert the group lock ioctls in
00046  * conjunction with sendfile. Some bugs were found when both were used
00047  * at the same time. See LU-6368 and LU-6371.
00048  *
00049  * The program will exit as soon as a non zero error code is returned.
00050  *
00051  * It can be called like this:
00052  *
00053  * dd if=/dev/zero of=/mnt/lustre/foo1 bs=1M count=40
00054  * ./sendfile_grouplock /mnt/lustre/foo1
00055  */
00056 
00057 #include <stdlib.h>
00058 #include <errno.h>
00059 #include <getopt.h>
00060 #include <fcntl.h>
00061 #include <sys/types.h>
00062 #include <sys/stat.h>
00063 #include <time.h>
00064 #include <unistd.h>
00065 #include <poll.h>
00066 #include <sys/sendfile.h>
00067 
00068 #include <lustre/lustreapi.h>
00069 #include <lustre/lustre_idl.h>
00070 
00071 #define ERROR(fmt, ...)                                                 \
00072         fprintf(stderr, "%s: %s:%d: %s: " fmt "\n",                     \
00073                 program_invocation_short_name, __FILE__, __LINE__,      \
00074                 __func__, ## __VA_ARGS__);
00075 
00076 #define DIE(fmt, ...)                           \
00077         do {                                    \
00078                 ERROR(fmt, ## __VA_ARGS__);     \
00079                 exit(EXIT_FAILURE);             \
00080         } while (0)
00081 
00082 #define ASSERTF(cond, fmt, ...)                                         \
00083         do {                                                            \
00084                 if (!(cond))                                            \
00085                         DIE("assertion '%s' failed: "fmt,               \
00086                             #cond, ## __VA_ARGS__);                     \
00087         } while (0)
00088 
00089 #define PERFORM(testfn) \
00090         do {                                                            \
00091                 fprintf(stderr, "Starting test " #testfn " at %lld\n",  \
00092                         (unsigned long long)time(NULL));                \
00093                 testfn();                                               \
00094                 fprintf(stderr, "Finishing test " #testfn " at %lld\n", \
00095                         (unsigned long long)time(NULL));                \
00096         } while (0)
00097 
00098 /* This test will copy from source_file to dest_file */
00099 static const char *source_file;
00100 static char *dest_file;
00101 static unsigned long source_crc; /* CRC32 of original file */
00102 
00103 /*
00104  * A small CRC32 implementation, from RFC 1952
00105  */
00106 
00107 /* Table of CRCs of all 8-bit messages. */
00108 static unsigned long crc_table[256];
00109 
00110 /* Flag: has the table been computed? Initially false. */
00111 static int crc_table_computed;
00112 
00113 /* Make the table for a fast CRC. */
00114 static void make_crc_table(void)
00115 {
00116         unsigned long c;
00117 
00118         int n, k;
00119         for (n = 0; n < 256; n++) {
00120                 c = (unsigned long) n;
00121                 for (k = 0; k < 8; k++) {
00122                         if (c & 1)
00123                                 c = 0xedb88320L ^ (c >> 1);
00124                         else
00125                                 c = c >> 1;
00126                 }
00127                 crc_table[n] = c;
00128         }
00129         crc_table_computed = 1;
00130 }
00131 
00132 /*
00133  * Update a running crc with the bytes buf[0..len-1] and return the
00134  * updated crc. The crc should be initialized to zero. Pre- and
00135  * post-conditioning (one's complement) is performed within this
00136  * function so it shouldn't be done by the caller. Usage example:
00137  *
00138  *      unsigned long crc = 0L;
00139  *
00140  *      while (read_buffer(buffer, length) != EOF) {
00141  *              crc = update_crc(crc, buffer, length);
00142  *      }
00143  *      if (crc != original_crc) error();
00144  */
00145 static unsigned long update_crc(unsigned long crc,
00146                                 unsigned char *buf, int len)
00147 {
00148         unsigned long c = crc ^ 0xffffffffL;
00149         int n;
00150 
00151         if (!crc_table_computed)
00152                 make_crc_table();
00153         for (n = 0; n < len; n++)
00154                 c = crc_table[(c ^ buf[n]) & 0xff] ^ (c >> 8);
00155 
00156         return c ^ 0xffffffffL;
00157 }
00158 
00159 /* Cleanup our test file. */
00160 static void cleanup(void)
00161 {
00162         unlink(dest_file);
00163 }
00164 
00165 /* Compute the CRC32 of a file */
00166 static unsigned long compute_crc(const char *fname)
00167 {
00168         unsigned char buf[1024*1024];
00169         unsigned long crc = 0L;
00170         struct stat stbuf;
00171         int fd;
00172         int rc;
00173         size_t filesize;
00174 
00175         fd = open(fname, O_RDONLY);
00176         ASSERTF(fd >= 0, "open failed for '%s': %s",
00177                 fname, strerror(errno));
00178 
00179         rc = fstat(fd, &stbuf);
00180         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "fstat of '%s' failed: %s", fname, strerror(errno));
00181         filesize = stbuf.st_size;
00182 
00183         while (filesize != 0) {
00184                 size_t to_read = sizeof(buf);
00185                 ssize_t sret;
00186 
00187                 if (to_read > filesize)
00188                         to_read = filesize;
00189 
00190                 sret = read(fd, buf, to_read);
00191                 ASSERTF(sret >= 0, "read of %zu bytes from '%s' failed: %s",
00192                         to_read, fname, strerror(errno));
00193                 ASSERTF(sret > 0, "unexpected EOF for '%s'",
00194                         fname);
00195 
00196                 filesize -= sret;
00197                 crc = update_crc(crc, buf, sret);
00198         }
00199 
00200         close(fd);
00201 
00202         return crc;
00203 }
00204 
00205 /* Helper. Copy a file with sendfile. The destination will be
00206  * created. If a group lock is 0, it means do not take one. */
00207 static int sendfile_copy(const char *source, int source_gid,
00208                          const char *dest, int dest_gid)
00209 {
00210         int rc;
00211         struct stat stbuf;
00212         size_t filesize;
00213         int fd_in;
00214         int fd_out;
00215 
00216         fd_in = open(source, O_RDONLY);
00217         ASSERTF(fd_in >= 0, "open failed for '%s': %s",
00218                 source, strerror(errno));
00219 
00220         rc = fstat(fd_in, &stbuf);
00221         ASSERTF(rc == 0, "fstat of '%s' failed: %s", source, strerror(errno));
00222         filesize = stbuf.st_size;
00223 
00224         if (source_gid != 0) {
00225                 rc = llapi_group_lock(fd_in, source_gid);
00226                 ASSERTF(rc == 0, "cannot set group lock %d for '%s': %s",
00227                         source_gid, source, strerror(-rc));
00228         }
00229 
00230         fd_out = open(dest, O_WRONLY | O_TRUNC | O_CREAT, 0644);
00231         ASSERTF(fd_out >= 0, "creation failed for '%s': %s",
00232                 dest, strerror(errno));
00233 
00234         if (dest_gid != 0) {
00235                 rc = llapi_group_lock(fd_out, dest_gid);
00236                 ASSERTF(rc == 0, "cannot set group lock %d for '%s': %s",
00237                         dest_gid, dest, strerror(-rc));
00238         }
00239 
00240         /* Transfer by 10M blocks */
00241         while (filesize != 0) {
00242                 size_t to_copy = 10*1024*1024;
00243                 ssize_t sret;
00244 
00245                 if (to_copy > filesize)
00246                         to_copy = filesize;
00247 
00248                 sret = sendfile(fd_out, fd_in, NULL, to_copy);
00249                 rc = errno;
00250 
00251                 /* Although senfile can return less than requested,
00252                  * that should not happen under present conditions. At
00253                  * the very least, make sure that a decent size was
00254                  * copied. See LU-6371. */
00255 
00256                 ASSERTF(sret != 0, "sendfile read 0 bytes");
00257                 ASSERTF(sret > 0, "sendfile failed: %s", strerror(rc));
00258                 ASSERTF(sret > 100*1024,
00259                         "sendfile read too little data: %zd bytes", sret);
00260 
00261                 if (sret != to_copy)
00262                         fprintf(stderr,
00263                                "Warning: sendfile returned %zd bytes instead of %zu requested\n",
00264                                sret, to_copy);
00265 
00266                 filesize -= sret;
00267 
00268         }
00269 
00270         close(fd_out);
00271         close(fd_in);
00272 
00273         return 0;
00274 }
00275 
00276 /* Basic sendfile, without lock taken */
00277 static void test10(void)
00278 {
00279         unsigned long crc;
00280 
00281         cleanup();
00282         sendfile_copy(source_file, 0, dest_file, 0);
00283         sync();
00284 
00285         crc = compute_crc(dest_file);
00286         ASSERTF(source_crc == crc, "CRC differs: %lu and %lu", source_crc, crc);
00287 }
00288 
00289 /* sendfile, source locked */
00290 static void test11(void)
00291 {
00292         unsigned long crc;
00293 
00294         cleanup();
00295         sendfile_copy(source_file, 85543, dest_file, 0);
00296         sync();
00297 
00298         crc = compute_crc(dest_file);
00299         ASSERTF(source_crc == crc, "CRC differs: %lu and %lu", source_crc, crc);
00300 }
00301 
00302 /* sendfile, destination locked */
00303 static void test12(void)
00304 {
00305         unsigned long crc;
00306 
00307         cleanup();
00308         sendfile_copy(source_file, 0, dest_file, 98765);
00309         sync();
00310 
00311         crc = compute_crc(dest_file);
00312         ASSERTF(source_crc == crc, "CRC differs: %lu and %lu", source_crc, crc);
00313 }
00314 
00315 /* sendfile, source and destination locked, with same lock number */
00316 static void test13(void)
00317 {
00318         const int gid = 8765;
00319         unsigned long crc;
00320 
00321         cleanup();
00322         sendfile_copy(source_file, gid, dest_file, gid);
00323         sync();
00324 
00325         crc = compute_crc(dest_file);
00326         ASSERTF(source_crc == crc, "CRC differs: %lu and %lu", source_crc, crc);
00327 }
00328 
00329 /* sendfile, source and destination locked, with different lock number */
00330 static void test14(void)
00331 {
00332         unsigned long crc;
00333 
00334         cleanup();
00335         sendfile_copy(source_file, 98765, dest_file, 34543);
00336         sync();
00337 
00338         crc = compute_crc(dest_file);
00339         ASSERTF(source_crc == crc, "CRC differs: %lu and %lu", source_crc, crc);
00340 }
00341 
00342 /* Basic sendfile, without lock taken, to /dev/null */
00343 static void test15(void)
00344 {
00345         sendfile_copy(source_file, 0, "/dev/null", 0);
00346         sync();
00347 }
00348 
00349 /* sendfile, source locked, to /dev/null */
00350 static void test16(void)
00351 {
00352         sendfile_copy(source_file, 85543, "/dev/null", 0);
00353         sync();
00354 }
00355 
00356 int main(int argc, char *argv[])
00357 {
00358         int rc;
00359 
00360         if (argc != 2 || argv[1][0] != '/') {
00361                 fprintf(stderr,
00362                         "Argument must be an absolute path to a Lustre file\n");
00363                 return EXIT_FAILURE;
00364         }
00365 
00366         source_file = argv[1];
00367         rc = asprintf(&dest_file, "%s-dest", source_file);
00368         if (rc == -1) {
00369                 fprintf(stderr, "Allocation failure\n");
00370                 return EXIT_FAILURE;
00371         }
00372 
00373         /* Play nice with Lustre test scripts. Non-line buffered output
00374          * stream under I/O redirection may appear incorrectly. */
00375         setvbuf(stdout, NULL, _IOLBF, 0);
00376 
00377         cleanup();
00378         atexit(cleanup);
00379 
00380         /* Compute crc of original file */
00381         source_crc = compute_crc(source_file);
00382 
00383         PERFORM(test10);
00384         PERFORM(test11);
00385         PERFORM(test12);
00386         PERFORM(test13);
00387         PERFORM(test14);
00388         PERFORM(test15);
00389         PERFORM(test16);
00390 
00391         return EXIT_SUCCESS;
00392 }
